comments:
When the log shows a class cast exception, it does not show the class involved 
in the assignment. Knowing those classes would greatly help in figuring out 
what goes wrong.

We just print exception stack traces.  Whether the class name is included in the
stack trace is up to the VM/class library that you're using. If this information
isn't in the stack trace, then we have no way to compute it.

But I do not think you are printing the message of the exception? It just says 
java.lang.ClassCastException and normally I see the name of the casted class.

We do not print the exception message. We just call
Throwable#prinStackTrace(PrintWriter) on the exception object. As John said,
what that does will depend on the VM/class library implementation, but it
usually prints the exception message.

BTW, in what VM are you seeing this? Can you reproduce with different VMs?

I tried it again and it is not for all ClassCastExceptions. The Java VM is SUN 
1.4.2_03. The message really is:

java.lang.ClassCastException
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.PluginExportWizardPage.getListElemen
ts(PluginExportWizardPage.java:49)
	at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.BaseExportWizardPage$ExportListProvi
der.getElements(BaseExportWizardPage.java:70)


As you can see there is no text. However, my VM normally shows a text when it 
is there. Could it be a nested exception that is handled wrongly?

The only reason I can see for that to be happening is that (for some unknown
reason) the ClassCastException object does not have the class name in its
message (or does not have a message).

Just checked the Java spec to see if it may be VM dependent -
Throwable.printStackTrace is spec'd to call toString() on the exception, which
says it always prints the message. If you had a test case that we could try...

Found these two PRs on Sun bug database:

http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4488551.html
    RFE: More explicit error msg on ClassCastException

http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4921296.html
    ClassCastException needs more verbose detailMessage

Closing as invalid (VM bug/limitation).
